body: AI needs advantages like this over human players because it has no real intelligence. So it gets small cheats.

Well, how about an alternative A.I. that isn't that 'smart' with super weapons so you don't have to  disabling super powers completely? Someone named Jar Jar Bings or Gobby or Golum, idk.

In addition, imagine someone who's willing to learn the game first before playing against other human players.
Imagine this person being frustrated getting killed by the easiest A.I. out of nowhere game by game by game.
Imagine that this is true and the reason why I made up this issue in the first place.

I think @meldrian makes a good point here. Ofcourse the AI uses game information to make decisions because having an AI 'predict' where you will be placing buildings/units the same way humans do is pretty hard. But maybe the AI shouldn't directly go for the best kill, instead go for the second best location to bomb/strike. That way it's less frustrating for (new) players, but still a challenge to win. It's not fun when it's too easy.

Some time ago work was done on making A.I. pick their super-weapon/support powers targets more intelligently. And while the current code make it easy to adjust the yaml to make them pick more poorly, no such effort was made (since no real 'easy' A.I. exists anyway).

@WhomeverMayAttemptToWorkOnThis:
If you only wish to adjust the yaml then you still have options. Here are some possibilities.
You could make an A.I. airstrike itself (or it allies at least) by swapping Ally and Enemy in this:

```
        SupportPowerDecision@Airstrike:
            OrderName: AirstrikePowerInfoOrder
            MinimumAttractiveness: 2000
            Consideration@1:
                Against: Enemy
                Types: Vehicle, Infantry
                Attractiveness: 1
                TargetMetric: Value
                CheckRadius: 2c0
            Consideration@2:
                Against: Ally
                Types: Ground, Water
                Attractiveness: -10
                TargetMetric: Value
                CheckRadius: 2c0
```

to get this:

```
            Consideration@1:
                Against: Ally
                Types: Vehicle, Infantry
                Attractiveness: 1
                TargetMetric: Value
                CheckRadius: 2c0
            Consideration@2:
                Against: Enemy
                Types: Ground, Water
                Attractiveness: -10
                TargetMetric: Value
                CheckRadius: 2c0
```

Or you could, for example, make it use airstrikes less effectively by making it target buildings (which are unlikely to die from a single airstrike), rather than units.
